summary.p: 62 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 86; Qurʾānic Text: Q 23:109-23:113, Q 24:4-24:63; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 270 x 190mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragments Marcel 84, Marcel 87, Marcel 102/1 and Marcel 124 (NLR) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Марсель 86
62 fol. 190×270 mm (1.4). Support: thin transparent parchment, rigid, of yellowish color, especially on the hair side. Writing material: ink, from light brown to dark brown.
Collation: seven quires, the first and last ones incomplete.
I: H1F H2F S / F3H S F4H (lacuna of six folios between fol. 2 and 3);
II: H5F S H6F S H7F S H8F S H9F / F10H F11H S F12H S F13H S F14H S (fol. 9 and 10 are a bifolium, others are singletons with stubs);
III: H15F H16F S H17F S H18F S H19F S / F20H S F21H S F22H S F23H S F24H (fol. 15 and 24 are a bifolium, others are singletons with stubs);
IV: H25F H26F S H27F S H28F S H29F / F30H F31H S F32H S F33H S F34H (fol. 25 and 34, 29 and 30 are bifolia, others are singletons with stubs);
V: H35F H36F S H37F S H38F S H39F S / F40H S F41H S F42H S F43H S F44H (fol. 35 and 44 are a bifolium, others are singletons with stubs);
VI: H45F H46F S H47F S H48F S H49F S / F50H S F51H S F52H S F53H S F54H (fol. 45 and 54 are a bifolium, others are singletons with stubs);
VII: H55F H56F H57F S H58F S H59F / F60H F61H S F62H S S (fol. 59 and 60 are a bifolium, others are singletons with stubs except fol. 55 – a bifolium that has lost its other half).

Text layout: 84×168 mm (2.0), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: →D III, horizontal elements of some letters are stretched for 6 cm and even more. Diacritics: mostly absent, on fol. 32r-32v red and blue double diagonal dashes. Vocalization: large round dots in red, blue and green paint.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold an colors; for groups of five verses – medallions on the margins (type тип 3.C.II) in gold and colors, with the inscribed word خمس (fol. 4r, 11r, 19r, 33v, 44r, 52r), on fol. 4r, 33v, 44r, 52r accompanied with the small letter ﻪ (hā) written in brown ink to mark the actual border of the verse; for groups of 10 verses – medallions on the margins or in the text line (types 3.C.II and 4.A.I), in gold and colors, with inscribed verse numbers (ماية عشر – fol. 1v, عشر – fol. 7r, عشرون – fol. 14r, ثلاثون – fol. 23v, اربعون – fol. 39r, خمسون – fol. 47r, ستون – fol. 62r), they are accompanied in the text line with rosettes (fol. 1v, 14r) drawn in paint or ink or simple circles in ink to mark the actual border of the verse (types 1.A.I, 3.1.2 or 3.1.3).
Stitching: fragments of threads have been preserved in the punctures of the central bifolia of the quires; traces of brown substance (leather?) on the outer folds of quires.

Inscriptions: numbers of the surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in brown ink on the upper margins of fol. 1r–3r, 54v–62v; on fol. 4r–54r numbers of surahs and verses inscribed in pencil on the outer margins.

Defects: stains, traces of moisture on the upper margins; some damage to upper margins caused probably by rodents; fol. 7–8, 20–21, 30, 32–33, 40, 44, 51, and especially 58–60 have numerous tears cause by the forced opening of the conglutinated pages; text from the opposite page imprinted on some leaves; ink has partly peeled off on the flesh sides.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “I”, brief annotation in French in brown ink “62 f. \ Sourate XXIII v. 111 à 115 \ XXIV v. 4 à 63” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 63.
Old accession numbers: I (on the wrapping); B. 63 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–2v. Surah 23, verses 111(109)–115(113). Incipit: [لا تكلّمون] إنّه كان فريق . Explicit: لبثنا يو[ماً او بعضَ يومٍ] .
Fol. 3r–62v. Surah 24, verses 4(4)–63(63). Incipit: [المحصَنا]ت ثم لم يأتوا . Explicit: يتسلّلون منكم [لِوَاذاً].
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 87, Marcel 102 (fol. 3 and 5), Marcel 124 (NLR)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
